{"step_by_step_thinking": "Chemotactic cytokines are a group of cytokines that attract and direct the movement of immune cells towards the site of inflammation or infection. IL-1, IL-6, and TNF are not typically classified as chemotactic cytokines. IL-8, on the other hand, is a well-known chemotactic cytokine that plays a crucial role in recruiting neutrophils to the site of infection or inflammation. Therefore, the correct answer is C. IL-8.", "answer_choice": "C"}
